This is my first instance of being told that the liberals have been the only ones screaming for gun control and the conservatives have been the only ones screaming to keep their guns. I had always thought this to be a bi-partisan issue with both sides being well represented by both factions. Admittedly, it has seemed a bit skewed toward liberals wanting to take guns from conservatives, but not so much that I would think it expected of any liberal to want my gun taken away.

Well, I like to call myself, liberally conservative. ;) I vote my guns. If the candidate says he'll protect my gun rights, and he, or she, has the history to prove it, they'll get my vote.
 
 So, no, I didn't vote for Obama, in spite of what he said during the campaign, and in spite of that traitorous NRA member who made that disgusting ad for BHO.
 
 Frankly, I'd have preferred someone other than McCain also, but all the better choices were not in the race.
